sourceMeaningMnemonic: What you <radical>say</radical> to <radical>oneself</radical> (yourself), you decide to <kanji>write down</kanji>. Whether this is in the form of a journal, diary, or blog, you feel the need to <kanji>record</kanji> these important thoughts in some way.
meaningInfo:
Just imagine writing in a diary and saying everything to write aloud to yourself in your head. 

"Dear me, today I learned a lot of new kanji on WaniKani. It was the best. I love the crabigator sooooo much. Love, me."
readingMnemonic: You need to protect what you <kanji>write down</kanji> and <kanji>record</kanji> for yourself with a <reading>key</reading> (<ja>き</ja>). These are your special thoughts and feelings, you don't want anyone else to see! Lock them away with a key!
readingInfo: Picture the key you use to keep what you write down a secret. What does it look like? How does it feel in your hands?
